pageContext.claim: “No, but this attacks older people very viciously, by the way. It can be if it's the wrong person. These football players are very young, strong people and physically, I mean, they're physically in extraordinary shape. They're not going to have a problem. You're not going to see people.”
pageContext.analysis: The president is conflating a few different things. First of all, young people are not immune. The virus has ripped through college campuses and a “disturbing” number of cases from the summer surge we're in younger people. Roughly one percent of covid-19 infections in young people result in hospitalizations (though some studies suggest that number may be as high as 1 in 3, and may well face additional long term health consequences.
